intro: Khaya kissiensis, commonly known as African shea tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and large, bipinnate leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by elongated pods containing flat, edible seeds. These seeds are valued for their high oil content, which is used in cosmetics and food products. The plant also plays an important ecological role in its native habitat.
